title: Overheating / Cooling Issues
description: Diagnose overheating on the liquid-cooled Kymco AK 550i 550cc parallel-twin maxi-scooter.

nodes.text: How does overheating present on your AK 550i?

nodes.warning: NEVER open radiator cap when hot. Severe burn risk from pressurized coolant.
nodes.instructions: Check overflow reservoir (MIN/MAX marks). The AK 550i parallel-twin generates significant heat, especially in traffic. If reservoir is empty, check radiator (cold only). Use 50/50 coolant mix. The Noodoe display shows temp — monitor for normal operating range.

nodes.warning: Coolant is toxic to animals and children.
nodes.instructions: Top up and inspect: (1) All hoses and clamps — the twin has more cooling hoses than singles, (2) Water pump weep hole, (3) Radiator for damage or corrosion, (4) Head gasket area between both cylinders, (5) Thermostat housing. Use a pressure tester for hard-to-find leaks.

nodes.warning: Internal coolant leak is serious. Stop riding.
nodes.instructions: On the AK 550i parallel-twin, internal leaks can occur at the head gasket between cylinders or between coolant passages and oil galleries. Check: (1) Oil dipstick/sight glass — milky oil = coolant mixing, (2) Exhaust — white smoke with sweet smell = coolant burning, (3) Coolant — bubbles when engine running (cap off, cold) = combustion gases entering coolant. Any of these = head gasket failure.

nodes.warning: Fan starts suddenly — keep fingers clear.
nodes.instructions: Let engine idle until hot. The AK 550i fan should activate at approximately 95-100C. Monitor temp on the Noodoe display. If fan does not come on: (1) Check fan fuse, (2) Check fan connector, (3) Test fan motor with direct 12V, (4) Check temp switch/sensor.

Feel upper radiator hose after the engine warms up. If hose stays cold while the engine is hot = thermostat stuck closed. Coolant is not circulating to the radiator. The AK 550i twin reaches operating temp quickly — the hose should be warm within 5-7 minutes of running.

Inspect: (1) Radiator fins — clean of bugs, dirt, road debris (common on the AK 550i due to its low-mounted radiator), (2) Airflow path — nothing blocking the radiator, (3) Radiator cap — test with pressure tester or just replace (cheap). A weak cap reduces boiling point.

nodes.warning: Stop engine NOW. Do not open radiator cap when hot. Wait 30+ minutes to cool.
nodes.action: Shut off engine and let it cool completely.
nodes.details: Do not restart until the engine is cool, coolant level is checked, and the cause is identified. Running a twin without adequate cooling can warp the head or blow the head gasket.
The AK 550i has more cooling hoses than single-cylinder scooters. Replace with OEM or silicone equivalents. Refill with 50/50 coolant and bleed air.

nodes.action: Replace water pump seal or entire pump.
nodes.details: Weep hole dripping = seal failure. Replace promptly before it becomes a catastrophic leak. The twin's higher flow demands mean a pump failure has more immediate consequences.
Stone damage or corrosion. Refill with 50/50 coolant and bleed air thoroughly. Consider a radiator guard to prevent future damage.

nodes.warning: Stop riding immediately. Coolant in oil destroys bearings. Running with a blown head gasket can destroy the engine.
nodes.details: The AK 550i parallel-twin head gasket seals between two cylinders and multiple coolant/oil passages. This is a significant repair. White smoke, milky oil, or bubbles in coolant all confirm head gasket failure. Have the head checked for warping during replacement.
Verify operation after installation. The AK 550i relies heavily on the fan in slow traffic where the twin generates significant heat.

nodes.warning: Drain some coolant before removing sensor.
nodes.action: Replace the temperature sensor or fan switch.
nodes.details: The ECU uses the temp sensor for both fueling and fan control. A faulty sensor affects both. Check for fault codes on the Noodoe display or via diagnostic port.
Replace with OEM spec. Refill with 50/50 coolant and bleed air from the system. Run engine to operating temp and verify circulation.

nodes.action: Clean radiator fins with low-pressure water.
nodes.details: Spray from the engine side outward. Be gentle — fins bend easily. Consider installing a radiator guard to prevent future blockage from road debris.
A weak cap lowers the boiling point of coolant. Cheap, easy fix. Use the correct pressure rating for the AK 550i.

nodes.action: Verify the water pump is circulating coolant.
nodes.details: Squeeze the upper radiator hose at operating temperature — you should feel flow/pressure. No flow = failed impeller (impeller may have come loose from the shaft). Replace the water pump.
